column4: for some reason I'm typically getting less than 1k/s transfers with synaptic .............
it's ridiculous...... also, I had to switch my eth1 and eth0 in the /etc/udev stuff, don't know if that has anything to do with it
about 4 days for the upgrade woo hoo!
yeah, I was joking re: the yvonne influx
No, that is something unrelated... although you might want to try another mirror, which might induce the same issue if you do it wrong... heh
sounds fun! a different mirror? oh, for irc? eh I don't care about that, I'm just curious why my "language support update" is planning on taking 4 days to do itself
so how do I utilize this in my sources. ....
I'm not actually sure how I should recommend you do that, so I don't think I should... there is no simple way to switch mirror via GUI
I'm kind of decently able to figure things out, so I'd appreciate any input, really
astro76: I didn't see it with a quick browse... astro76 would you care to show him/her?
In System > Administration > Software Sources ... "Download From" under the check boxes... choose "Other" and browse to a desired mirror.
